data.event: Laid down as Panzerschiffe C, although it was initially known as Ersatz Braunschweig. (Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
Commissioned into the Kriegsmarine at Wilhelmshaven as Panzerschiffe Admiral Graf Spee (Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
Joined the rest of the fleet, as the fleet flagship (Feldgrau)
Took part in the fleet parade at Kiel for the dedication of the naval memorial at Laboe (Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
Took part in the Spithead International Naval Review on the occasion of the coronation of King George VI (Feldgrau) color="green"
(Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
(Feldgrau)
Took part in the fleet parade in Kiel Bay on the occasion of the state visit of Admiral von Horthy of Hungary. Discontinued service as the fleet flagship at this time (Feldgrau)
Training in Atlantic waters, making port at Vigo and Tangier (Feldgrau)
Training in Atlantic waters, making port at Bilbao (Feldgrau)

event.title: Erinnerung an die Heimkerhr des Memellandes

data.event: Took part in operations during the annexation of Memel (Feldgrau)

Service in Atlantic waters on naval manoeuvres along with Panzerschiffe Deutschland, Panzerschiffe Admiral Scheer, Kruizer Leipzig, Kruizer Koln, a Zerstorer, a Uboat tender, and various submarine flotillas. Made port at Ceuta and Lisbon (Feldgrau)

Along with Panzerschiffe Admiral Scheer, Aviso Hamburg, 3 Zerstorer and a number of Torpedoboots, Graf Spee escorted the transport fleet of the Legion Condor arriving from Spain. The transport fleet were escorted into the harbour at Hamburg (Feldgrau)
Recalled from torpedo firing exercises and ordered to prepare for war duty (Gilbey)

event.title: Left Wilhelmshaven for South Atlantic waters

data.event: (Feldgrau, Gilbey)
Admiral Graf Spee meets with Altmark in 25 deg 52 min N, 35 deg 49 min W. (Gilbey)
Held in a waiting position more than 900 miles east of Bahia (Feldgrau)
Released for operations against Allied merchant shipping in the South Atlantic and Indian Oceans (Feldgrau)
Graf Spee finds and sinks its first victim, the British freighter Clement (5051 BRT) while off of Pernambuco (Feldgrau)
In the steamship lane in the Atlantic between Capetown - Freetown (Feldgrau)
The British freighter Newton Beech (4651 BRT) is stopped and occupied by crew from the Graf Spee (Feldgrau)
The British freighter Ashlea (4222 BRT) is stopped and sunk (Feldgrau)
The Newton Beech (see 5 Oct) is sunk (Feldgrau)
The British freighter Huntsman (8196 BRT) is stopped and occupied by crew from the Graf Spee (Feldgrau)
On meeting Altmark again, Capt. Langsdorff transferred his prisoners to the supply ship, together with an officer and some men for their supervision (Gilbey)
The Huntsman (see 10 Oct) is sunk (Feldgrau)
The British motor ship Trevanion (5299 BRT) is stopped and sunk (Feldgrau)
Meeting with 'Altmark' in mid-Atlantic north-west of Capetown (Gilbey)
The Graf Spee moved into the Indian Ocean (Feldgrau) Langsdorff expected intense traffic running in the shipping lanes between Australia and Capetown (Gilbey)
The British motor tanker Africa Shell (706 BRT) is stopped and sunk (Feldgrau)
Graf Spee returns to her earlier operations area in the middle Atlantic sea lanes (Feldgrau)
On meeting 'Altmark', work began immediately to overhaul Graf Spee's engines and take on fuel. (Gilbey)
Sinks the British freight steamer Doric Star (10,086 BRT) (Feldgrau) SS Doric Star sunk by gunfire south of St. Helena in position 19.15S, 05.05E (Blue Star Line)
Sinks the British refrigerator ship Tairoa (7983 BRT) (Feldgrau) In position 21,38'S 3,13W
Graf Spee meets the German supply ship Altmark at 25.5S, 24.5W. The Graf Spee had met the Altmark 9 times to refuel, and this was its last meeting with the ship (Feldgrau)

The Graf Spee sinks the British freight steamer Streonsalh (3895 BRT) (Feldgrau) German pocket battleship ADMIRAL GRAF SPEE sank steamer STREONSHALH (3895grt) south of Trinidad in 25‑01S, 27‑50W (NH.n)
